Hello I have had problems with mods, which has to do with memory, apparently in windows there is an excess of memory for ksp which in linux there is not. So I decided to install linux. But i have read that must be a Debian distribution, or could be an Ubunto maybe?. In case just works for Debian, which distro is the best or more user friendly?

Thanks.

Ubuntu, Kubuntu, Xubuntu or any other *buntu you'll find is probably very user friendly. If you're looking for something that matches the Windows feel it'll probably be Kubuntu. Linux will always take a lot of getting used to, and probably you'll need to acquire a lot of technical knowledge too.

Ok, so with ubuntu KSP will works ?

Ubuntu is based on Debian (though it does add a lot of stuff particular to Ubuntu). I've been playing KSP on Ubuntu no problem.

In terms of variants, regular Ubuntu is a pretty different UI to Windows. You might like it, you might not. Linux Mint (separate, but based on Ubuntu) has a more familiar interface and is well-regarded. If you want something quite streamlined, along the lines of XP interface-wise (but without the fisher price looks), try Lubuntu.
